title: Package Functions
text: install package, please use: installation give latest version package, regardless status CRAN.

title: Package Functions
text: demonstrate use visual sensitivity analysis, use study effect child maltreatment extent mental health problems terms internalising externalising behaviour. study Kisely colleagues (2018) based general population sample Brisbane, Australia, compared 3554 mother-child pairs without ‘substantiated child maltreatment’ , example, 73 pairs child neglect. Note results vary across different types maltreatment assessed, choose child neglect results (smaller still considerable l adjustment) particularly suited illustrating sensitivity analysis. Maltreatment assessed ‘linkage state child protection agency data’. Internalising externalising behaviours measured using Youth Self-Report (YSR) scale around age 21. study reports unadjusted mean differences mean differences adjusted ‘gender, parental ethnicity, maternal age, family income, maternal relationship status, maternal education, youth income level, youth education level, youth marital status’ (e.g., likely based ordinary least squares regression, paper specify ). obtain estimates two-tailed 95% confidence intervals d scale, used calculate_d function. See supplemental document https://static.cambridge.org/content/id/urn:cambridge.org:id:article:S0007125018002076/resource/name/S0007125018002076sup001.docx

title: Package Functions
text: can calculate unadjusted scores supplemental material provided authors. Note, can also calculate directly t-test output R, t-value, dataframe scores.
code: # internalising internal_unadj <-    calculate_d(m1 = 14.37, # neglect mean               sd1 = 10.716, # neglect sd               n1 = 71, # neglect n               m2 = 10.69, # none mean               sd2 = 8.219, # none sd               n2 = 3653, # none n               a = .05, # alpha/confidence interval               lower = TRUE) # lower or upper bound  internal_unadj$d # effect size  #> [1] 0.4448249 internal_unadj$dlow # non-directional non-central lower  #> [1] 0.2097233 internal_unadj$dlow_central # non-directional central lower  #> [1] 0.2096767 internal_unadj$done_low # one-tailed non-central lower #> [1] 0.2475166 internal_unadj$done_low_central # one-tailed central lower #> [1] 0.2474974  # externalising external_unadj <-    calculate_d(m1 = 13.14, sd1 = 8.066, n1 = 71,              m2 = 9.42, sd2 = 6.764, n2 = 3653,              a = .05, lower = TRUE)  external_unadj$d # effect size  #> [1] 0.5478007 external_unadj$dlow # non-directional non-central lower  #> [1] 0.3125801 external_unadj$dlow_central # non-directional central lower  #> [1] 0.3125404 external_unadj$done_low # one-tailed non-central lower #> [1] 0.3503914 external_unadj$done_low_central # one-tailed central lower #> [1] 0.3503791

title: Package Functions
text: adjusted scores displayed raw score format, rather mean difference scores. can use calculate_d different way:
code: # internalising m_diff <- 2.73 lower <- 0.77 # ci is m - t_alpha*SE = lower SE <- (m_diff - lower)/qt(.025, # .05 / 2                     df = (71+3653 - 2), # n - 1 + n - 1                     lower.tail = FALSE)  SE #> [1] 0.9996932  # confirm correct # p value is listed as .006 pt(q = m_diff / SE, # t value    df = (71+3653 - 2), # df     lower.tail = FALSE)*2 # upper tail * 2 for two tails  #> [1] 0.006347121  internal_adj <-    calculate_d(t = m_diff/SE, # t-score             n1 = 71, # neglect n             n2 = 3653, # none n             a = .05,  # alpha/confidence interval             lower = TRUE) # lower or upper bound  internal_adj$d # effect size  #> [1] 0.08952364 internal_adj$dlow # non-directional non-central lower  #> [1] 0.09223112 internal_adj$dlow_central # non-directional central lower  #> [1] -0.1454161 internal_adj$done_low # one-tailed non-central lower #> [1] 0.1300084 internal_adj$done_low_central # one-tailed central lower #> [1] -0.1076289  # externalising m_diff <- 3.10 lower <- 1.49 # ci is m - t_alpha*SE = lower SE <- (m_diff - lower)/qt(.025, # .05 / 2                     df = (71+3653 - 2), # n - 1 + n - 1                     lower.tail = FALSE)  SE #> [1] 0.8211765  # confirm correct # p value is listed as < .001 pt(q = m_diff / SE, # t value    df = (71+3653 - 2), # df     lower.tail = FALSE)*2 # upper tail * 2 for two tails  #> [1] 0.0001624566  external_adj <-    calculate_d(t = m_diff/SE, # t-score             n1 = 71, # neglect n             n2 = 3653, # none n             a = .05,  # alpha/confidence interval             lower = TRUE) # lower or upper bound  external_adj$d # effect size  #> [1] 0.1237562 external_adj$dlow # non-directional non-central lower  #> [1] 0.2172419 external_adj$dlow_central # non-directional central lower  #> [1] -0.1111915 external_adj$done_low # one-tailed non-central lower #> [1] 0.2550364 external_adj$done_low_central # one-tailed central lower #> [1] -0.07340311

title: Package Functions
text: Given statistics, can use visualize_c visualize combinations effect size correlation support effect.
code: plots_1 <- visualize_c(dlow = internal_unadj$dlow_central)$graph +    ggtitle("Internal Unadjusted") +    annotate("text", label = paste0("l = ", round(internal_unadj$dlow_central, 2)),             x = -1.5, y = -.5) plots_2 <- visualize_c(dlow = external_unadj$dlow_central)$graph +    ggtitle("External Unadjusted") +    annotate("text", label = paste0("l = ", round(external_unadj$dlow_central, 2)),             x = -1.5, y = -.5) plots_3 <- visualize_c(dlow = internal_adj$dlow_central)$graph +    ggtitle("Internal Adjusted") +      annotate("text", label = paste0("l = ", round(internal_adj$dlow_central, 2)),             x = -1.5, y = -.5) plots_4 <- visualize_c(dlow = external_adj$dlow_central)$graph +    ggtitle("External Adjusted") +    annotate("text", label = paste0("l = ", round(external_adj$dlow_central, 2)),           x = -1.5, y = -.5)  plot_grid(plots_1, plots_2,            plots_3, plots_4,            nrow = 2) ggsave(filename = "visualize_c.png") #> Saving 7.29 x 4.51 in image

title: Package Functions
code: adjusted_coef(effect_xz = .2, # effect of x and z     effect_uxz = .4, # effect of x, u, and z     effect_d = .12) # effect size of difference score between groups  #> [1] 0.152

title: Package Functions
code: visual_d <-    estimate_d(m1 = 14.37, # neglect mean           sd1 = 10.716, # neglect sd           n1 = 71, # neglect n           m2 = 10.69, # none mean           sd2 = 8.219, # none sd           n2 = 3653) # none n  visual_d$d #> [1] 0.4448249  visual_d$graph estimate_d(d = .25)$graph

title: Adjust coefficient for confounders — adjusted_coef
text: function calculates adjusted effect controlling confounding effects. can use d values standardized regression coefficients.

title: Adjust coefficient for confounders — adjusted_coef
text: effect_xz Effect x y given z effect_uxz Effect u y given x z effect_d Effect size difference interest

title: Adjust coefficient for confounders — adjusted_coef
text: Adjusted effect size x y given u z

title: APA Format — apa
text: function formats decimals leading zeroes creating reports scientific style.

title: APA Format — apa
text: value set numeric values, either single number, vector, set columns. decimals number decimal points desired output. leading Logical value: TRUE leading zeroes decimals FALSE leading zeroes decimals. default TRUE.

title: APA Format — apa
text: function creates "pretty" character vectors numeric variables   printing part report. value can take single number,   matrix, vector, multiple columns data frame, long   numeric. values coerced numeric characters   logical values, process may result error values   truly alphabetical.

what: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: function displays d two subjects groups gives central non-central confidence interval using pooled standard deviation denominator.

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
code: calculate_d(   m1 = NULL,   m2 = NULL,   sd1 = NULL,   sd2 = NULL,   n1 = NULL,   n2 = NULL,   t = NULL,   model = NULL,   df = NULL,   x_col = NULL,   y_col = NULL,   a = 0.05,   lower = TRUE )

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: m1 mean group one m2 mean group two sd1 standard deviation group one sd2 standard deviation group two n1 sample size group one n2 sample size group two t optional, calculate d independent t, must include n1 n2 degrees freedom model optional, calculate d t.test independent t, must still include n1 n2 df optional dataframe includes x_col y_col x_col name column contains factor levels numeric vector group 1 scores y_col name column contains dependent score numeric vector group 2 scores significance level lower Use indicate want lower upper bound d one sided confidence intervals. d positive, generally want lower = TRUE, negative d values enter lower = FALSE upper bound closer zero.

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: Provides effect size (Cohen's *d*) associated central non-central confidence intervals, *t*-statistic, confidence intervals associated means group, well standard deviations standard errors means group. one-tailed confidence interval also included sensitivity analyses. d effect size dlow noncentral lower level confidence interval d value dhigh noncentral upper level confidence interval d value dlow_central central lower level confidence interval d value dhigh_central central upper level confidence interval d value done_low noncentral lower bound one tailed confidence interval done_low_central central lower bound one tailed confidence interval M1 mean group one sd1 standard deviation group one mean se1 standard error group one mean M1low lower level confidence interval group one mean M1high upper level confidence interval group one mean M2 mean group two sd2 standard deviation group two mean se2 standard error group two mean M2low lower level confidence interval group two mean M2high upper level confidence interval group two mean spooled pooled standard deviation sepooled pooled standard error n1 sample size group one n2 sample size group two df degrees freedom (n1 - 1 + n2 - 1) t t-statistic p p-value estimate d statistic confidence interval APA style markdown printing statistic t-statistic APA style markdown printing

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: calculate \(d_s\), mean two subtracted mean one divided pooled standard deviation. $$d_s = \frac{M_1 - M_2}{S_{pooled}}$$ provide one combination following: 1: m1 n2 2: t, n1, n2 3: model, n1, n2 4: df, "x_col", "y_col" 5: x_col, y_col numeric vectors

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d

text: d effect size

title: Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
text: Kraemer H.C., Kupfer D.J. (2006) Size treatment effects importance clinical research practice. Biolological Psychiatry, 59, 990–996. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.biopsych.2005.09.014

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: function calculates probability superiority independent samples Cohen's d calculation.

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
code: probability_superiority(   d = NULL,   m1 = NULL,   m2 = NULL,   sd1 = NULL,   sd2 = NULL,   n1 = NULL,   n2 = NULL,   a = 0.05,   t = NULL,   model = NULL,   df = NULL,   x_col = NULL,   y_col = NULL )

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: d effect size m1 mean group one m2 mean group two sd1 standard deviation group one sd2 standard deviation group two n1 sample size group one n2 sample size group two significance level t optional, calculate d independent t, must include n1 n2 degrees freedom model optional, calculate d t.test independent t, must still include n1 n2 df optional dataframe includes x_col y_col x_col name column contains factor levels numeric vector group 1 scores y_col name column contains dependent score numeric vector group 2 scores

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: probability superiority.

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: provide one combination following: 1: d 2: m1 n2 3: t, n1, n2 4: model, n1, n2 5: df, "x_col", "y_col" 6: x_col, y_col numeric vectors

what: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
text: function calculates proportion overlap two independent group d effect size calculations. Cohen's u1, u2, u3 proportion overlap provided.

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
code: proportion_overlap(   model = NULL,   x_col = NULL,   y_col = NULL,   df = NULL,   d = NULL )

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
text: model saved independent t-test model x_col name column contains factor levels numeric vector group 1 scores y_col name column contains dependent score numeric vector group 2 scores df optional dataframe includes x_col y_col d previously calculated d value

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
text: list following: u1 Proportion non-overlap across distributions u2 Proportion one group proportion group u3 Proportion one group smaller median group p_o Proportional overlap distributions

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
